title: Human Activity Scoring System
description: Index definitions and scoring scales for predicting AI automation timelines. Activities are stored in activities.json. Index values are stored in indices/. Periodically-updated values (wave timelines, composite weights, activity assessments) are in assessments/

dataModel.description: Refactored data model separating activities from indicators

indices.description: Abstraction Level Index - measures symbolic vs physical operation
Error Tolerance Index - measures consequences of mistakes
Purpose Index - classifies fundamental human intent/goal
Feedback Loop Speed Index - measures time between action and outcome
Interpersonal Complexity Index - measures degree of human interaction

intrinsicScores.note: Intrinsic properties (abstraction, errorTolerance, feedbackSpeed, interpersonalComplexity, purpose) are stored in index files under indices/. These are inherent to the activity and do not change over time.

timeDependent.note: Time-dependent assessments (aiCapability, bottleneck, agiWave) are stored separately in assessments/. These change as AI technology evolves.

attributes.name: Abstraction Level
attributes.description: Measures the degree to which an activity operates in symbolic vs physical space
attributes.rationale: High-abstraction activities require only software; low-abstraction activities require physical sensing, planning, and actuation

levels.name: Pure Abstract
levels.definition: Operates entirely in symbol space. No physical grounding required.

levels.name: Grounded Abstract
levels.definition: Reasons about physical world but acts through digital intermediaries.

levels.name: Supervised Physical
levels.definition: Physical action in structured, predictable environments.

levels.name: Adaptive Physical
levels.definition: Physical action requiring real-time adaptation to variability.

levels.name: Deeply Embodied
levels.definition: Full sensorimotor integration, social presence, human-like dexterity.

attributes.name: Error Tolerance
attributes.description: Measures the consequences and recoverability of mistakes
attributes.rationale: Within any domain, low-error-tolerance activities automate later. Error tolerance interacts with abstraction (physical errors often irreversible).

levels.name: Very High
levels.definition: Errors trivial to correct, no real stakes, rapid iteration expected.

levels.name: High
levels.definition: Errors easily corrected, low stakes, iteration expected.

levels.name: Medium
levels.definition: Errors costly but recoverable, moderate stakes.

levels.name: Low
levels.definition: Errors expensive or harmful, limited recovery options.

levels.name: Critical
levels.definition: Errors potentially catastrophic, irreversible, or life-threatening.

attributes.name: Feedback Loop Speed
attributes.description: Time between action and observable outcome
attributes.rationale: Faster feedback enables rapid learning and correction; slower feedback requires longer-term planning and prediction

attributes.name: Interpersonal Complexity
attributes.description: Degree and type of human interaction required
attributes.rationale: Social complexity adds requirements for theory of mind, emotional intelligence, and interpersonal dynamics

levels.name: None
levels.definition: Solo task, no human interaction

levels.name: Informational
levels.definition: Exchange information with humans

levels.name: Coordinative
levels.definition: Synchronize actions with humans

levels.name: Persuasive
levels.definition: Influence human beliefs or behavior

levels.name: Relational
levels.definition: Build trust, provide emotional support

attributes.name: Purpose
attributes.description: Classifies activities by their fundamental human intent and the type of value they create
attributes.rationale: Understanding the fundamental purpose of an activity provides insight into why humans do it and how AI might augment or replace it. Productive activities are most amenable to efficiency-based automation. Relational and restorative activities center on intrinsic human value.

levels.name: Productive
levels.definition: Creates tangible output, economic value, or new artifacts. Focus is on generating measurable results.

levels.name: Operational
levels.definition: Maintains, sustains, or supports existing systems and processes. Focus is on keeping things running.

levels.name: Developmental
levels.definition: Builds skills, knowledge, or capabilities. Focus is on growth and learning.

levels.name: Relational
levels.definition: Builds, maintains, or deepens human connections. Focus is on interpersonal bonds.

levels.name: Restorative
levels.definition: Recovers, heals, or maintains personal wellbeing. Focus is on self-care and restoration.

attributes.name: Current AI Capability
attributes.description: Current state of AI capability for this activity

values.definition: AI matches or exceeds median human performance
AI approaches human performance, deployment underway
AI assists but cannot fully replace humans

attributes.name: Primary Bottleneck
attributes.description: Main technical or social barrier to AI automation

values.description: Handling novel situations and edge cases

attributes.name: Estimated AGI Wave
attributes.description: Predicted timeframe for AI to achieve human-level capability
attributes.note: Current wave timelines are in assessments/ (agiWaveTimelines). Below is the schema reference.

timeDependentFields.note: These fields are stored in assessments/, not in activity files

exampleActivity.name: Writing Unit Tests
exampleActivity.description: Creating automated tests for software components

compositeScores.note: Weights for these formulas are configurable in assessments/ (compositeWeights). Below uses default weights.

automationReadiness.description: Overall estimate of how ready an activity is for AI automation
automationReadiness.formula: ((5 - abstraction) * weights.abstraction) + ((4 - errorTolerance) * weights.errorTolerance) + ((4 - interpersonalComplexity) * weights.interpersonalComplexity) + (capabilityScore * weights.aiCapability)

humanEssentiality.description: Degree to which human involvement provides irreplaceable value
